BodyName: Committee on State and Federal Legislation

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor  -  "AN ACT to amend the tax law, chapter 877 of the laws of 1975, chapter 880 of the laws of 1975, chapter 884 of the laws of 1975 and chapter 882 of the laws of 1977, all relating to the imposition of certain taxes in the city of New York, and to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to postponing expiration dates applicable  to certain taxes imposed by the city of New York (Part A); to amend the tax law, in  relation  to  the  imposition  and  rate  of personal  income taxes (Part B); to amend the tax law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to amending  certain definitions,  modifying the measure of consideration in certain transfers of controlling economic interests in real property, under the New York city real property transfer tax (Part C);  to  amend  the  local finance  law, in relation to the issuance of bonds or notes with variable rates of interest (Part D); to amend the administrative  code  of the city of New York, in relation to setting interest rates for under payments of city income and excise taxes (Part E); to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing an amnesty  program  authorizing  the  waiver  of  certain  penalties and certain interest with respect to the payment of  certain  overdue  tax liabilities  and  barring any civil, administrative or criminal action or proceeding relating thereto and establishing a hotel room occupancy tax amnesty program for small hotels authorizing the waiver of certain overdue tax liabilities and interest and penalties thereon  (Part F); to  amend  the real property tax law, in relation to allowing an additional tax on certain class one properties in any city  with  a  population  of  one million or more (Part G); to amend the tax law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to postponing the expiration of certain tax rates and taxes in the city of New  York (Part H); to authorize the public sale of taxicab licenses in the city of  New York (Part I); to amend the tax law, in relation to increasing the sales tax in cities with a population of one million or more;  and providing for the repeal of such provisions upon the expiration there of (Part J); to amend the education law, in relation to aid for teachers  of tomorrow recruitment and retention program and to amend part K of chapter 93 of the laws of 2002 amending the education law  relating to aid for teachers of tomorrow recruitment and retention program, and providing  for  the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof, in relation to the effectiveness thereof (Part K); to amend the public authorities law, in relation to indebtedness of the Battery Park  city authority  and  providing  for  the  repeal of certain provisions upon expiration thereof (Part L); in relation to providing aid  to  certain cities  (Part M); to amend the tax law, in relation to taxes in a city with a population of one million or more and to amend the  administrative  code  of  the  city  of New York, in relation to related members expense and income exclusions and add backs (Part N);  to  amend  the public  authorities law, in relation to bonds of the state of New York municipal bond bank agency (Part O); in relation to providing for  the continuation  of  the municipal assistance corporation for the city of New York (Part P); in relation to providing aid to the city of Buffalo (Part Q); to amend the tax law, in relation to the imposition  of  tax on  individuals  (Part  R);  to  amend  the  tax  law,  in relation to exemptions from sales and compensating use taxes for certain  clothing and  footwear (Part S); to amend the tax law, in relation to estimated tax on the sale or transfer of real property by nonresidents (Part T); to amend the alcoholic beverage control law, in relation to sales  for off-premises  consumption  (Part  U);  to amend the public authorities law, in relation to payments made to the city of New York (Part V); to amend the tax law and the  state  finance  law,  in  relation  to  the disbursement  of revenue from and the conduct of video lottery; and to repeal part E3 of a chapter of the laws of 2003, amending the  general business  law and other laws relating to implementing the state fiscal plan for the 2003-2004 state fiscal year, as proposed  in  legislative bill numbers S.1406-B and A.2106-B and paragraph 5 of subdivision a of section 1612  of  the tax law relating thereto (Part W); to amend the tax law, in relation to related members expense and income  exclusions and  add  backs and repealing certain provisions of such law relating thereto (Part X); to amend  the  state  finance  law  and  the  mental hygiene law, in relation to the problem and compulsive gambling education, prevention and treatment fund (Part Y); to amend the tax law, in relation  to  taxes  imposed  on native American nation or tribe lands(Part Z); to amend the tax law, in relation to entire  net  income  in the  case  of an attorney-in-fact (Part ZZ); to amend a chapter of the laws of 2003, amending the general business law and other laws  relating  to  implementing  the  state  fiscal plan for the 2003-2004 state fiscal year, as proposed in  legislative  bill  numbers  S.1406-B  and A.2106-B, in  relation  to making technical corrections thereto (PartA1); to amend a chapter of the laws  of  2003,  amending  the  general business  law and other laws relating to implementing the state fiscal plan for the 2003-2004 state fiscal year, as proposed  in  legislative bill  numbers  S.1406-B and A.2106-B, in relation to making technical corrections thereto (Part B1); to amend chapter 174  of  the  laws  of 1968  constituting  the  New  York state urban development corporation act, in relation to making certain technical corrections (Part C1); to amend the racing, pari-mutuel wagering and breeding law,  in  relation to approval of plans of corporation or association (Part D1); to amend the  environmental conservation law, in relation to waste tire management and recycling (Part E1); to make monies available to  the financial  assistance  to  business  dry  cleaner  program for eligible dry cleaner  businesses  in certain counties (Part F1); to amend a chapter of the laws of 2003, amending the general business law and other  laws relating to implementing the state fiscal plan for the 2003-2004 state fiscal  year, as proposed in legislative bill numbers S. 1406-B and A.2106-B, in relation to services and expenses of existing family  preservation  centers  (Part  G1); to amend a chapter of the laws of 2003, amending the general business law and other laws  relating  to  implementing  the state fiscal plan for the 2003-2004 state fiscal year, as proposed in legislative bill numbers S.1406-B and A.2106-B,  in relation  to  an  equipment  loan  fund for the disabled (Part H1); to amend a chapter of the laws of 2003, amending the general business law and other laws relating to implementing the state fiscal plan for  the 2003-2004 state  fiscal year, as proposed in legislative bill numbers S.1406-B and A.2106-B, in relation  to  making  technical  corrections thereto  (Part  I1);  to amend the social services law, in relation to certain payments for medical assistance (Part J1); to amend the public health law, in relation to general  hospital  inpatient  reimbursement and  tobacco control and insurance initiatives pool distribution (Part K1); to amend the public health law, in relation to  patient services payments  and  audit reports; to amend chapter 462 of the laws of 1996 relating to establishing a quality incentive program, in  relation  to making technical corrections thereto; and to repeal section 48 of part O2 of a chapter of the laws of 2003, amending the general business law and  other laws relating to implementing the state fiscal plan for the 2003-2004 state fiscal year, as proposed in legislative bill numbers S.1406-B and A.2106-B, relating to implementing language qualifying appropriations made by a chapter of the laws of 2003 enacting the health and mental hygiene budget (Part L1); to amend the public health law,  in  relation to health care initiatives pool distributions (Part M1); and to amend the mental hygiene law, in relation to the community mental health support and workforce investment program (Part N1)". S.4968 / A.8388
